Sentencas: Solid oxide cells operated reversibly between fuel cell and electrolysis modes are promising for energy storage with extremely high capacity.
Titulo: Stable high current density operation of La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ oxygen electrodes

Sentencas: La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta (LSCF) has become the dominant oxygen electrode material in electrolysis and reversible operation.
Titulo: Stable high current density operation of La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ oxygen electrodes

Sentencas: However, LSCF has been widely reported to degrade due to Sr surface segregation.
Titulo: Stable high current density operation of La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ oxygen electrodes

Sentencas: The present understanding is that the segregation rate and hence the degradation rate increases with increasing temperature and current density.
Titulo: Stable high current density operation of La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ oxygen electrodes

Sentencas: Here we present a study of LSCF electrode performance and stability carried out with a series of extended life tests (1000 hours) over a range of temperatures and reversing current densities.
Titulo: Stable high current density operation of La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ oxygen electrodes

Sentencas: Although the results at lower temperatures (650-700 degrees C) show the expected increase in segregation-induced degradation with increasing current density, at higher temperature (750 degrees C) stability is improved and the electrodes become fully stable at the highest current density of 1.5 A cm(-2), maintaining a stable polarization resistance of 0.08 Omega cm(2).
Titulo: Stable high current density operation of La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ oxygen electrodes

Sentencas: This unexpected result is explained by the increased electrochemical activity of LSCF at the higher temperature and a very rapid development of a stable surface segregated Sr layer.
Titulo: Stable high current density operation of La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ oxygen electrodes
